intro: Bidens forbesii subsp. kahiliensis, commonly known as the Kahili Bidens, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a trailing or prostrate growth habit. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped with serrated edges, and it produces yellow flowers with prominent central disk. It is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native habitat, including high salinity and volcanic soils.
